overview:
I am the owner of The Templeton Group, a Manhattan-based Macintosh support and consulting firm.

I am the owner of MacSupport.com, a telephone and remote support service for Mac home users.

I am the editor of SmokeScore.com, a Cigar Review journal.

I am an avid photographer, working on my first book entitled Moving Pieces about the chess players in Washington Square Park.

I am a mediocre, but earnest musician. I can noodle around on Guitar, Piano and Drums.

I live and work on a small, strange island in the Atlantic.

I am a proud dad to two beautiful boys, Simon and Elliot.

I am an uncle to twin boys, Marco and Joey and a baby girl named Serena.

I live a digital life and I am entrenched in technology.

I own some vacation property in a very remote part of Mexico with no phones or internet.

I have some very good friends and family who act as an amazing support structure for me.

I am a very lucky man.
